Package org.oa4mp.server.api.storage.servlet

Class ErrorServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • edu.uiuc.ncsa.security.servlet.AbstractServlet
          • org.oa4mp.server.api.storage.servlet.EnvServlet
            • org.oa4mp.server.api.storage.servlet.OA4MPServlet
              • org.oa4mp.server.api.storage.servlet.ErrorServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.uiuc.ncsa.security.core.Logable, Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig, TransactionFilter
    public class ErrorServlet
extends OA4MPServlet
    This servlet handles error redirects. If an error (such as a 404, 500 or anything else) occurs, OAuth will intecept the response and throw an exception -- losing any other information. Therefore, there must be a redirect and clients must be prepared to deal with these. Generally there are a few error type pages

    Created by Jeff Gaynor
    on 9/4/12 at 6:03 PM

    See Also:
